name: Avocado
properties: Avocados are rich in vitamin E, an antioxidant that may promote hair growth. They are a great source of essential fatty acids, which appear to be crucial for hair growth.

name: Eggs
properties: Eggs are a great source of protein and biotin, which are important for hair health and growth. A deficiency in either of these nutrients has been linked to hair loss.

name: Salmon
properties: Fish boasts high supplies of iron and vitamin B12, both of which are essential to skin and hair health.

name: Spinach
properties: Spinach is loaded with folate, iron, and vitamins A and C, which may promote hair growth. A deficiency in these nutrients may result in hair loss.

name: Sweet Potato
properties: Sweet potatoes are loaded with vitamin A, which helps aid sebum production. Other factors in this may help speed up the rate of hair growth.

name: Pumpkin Seeds
properties: Zinc found in pumpkin seeds helps with cellular turnover, cell division and in growth that help to form keratin, a protein that makes up hair.

name: Strawberry
properties: Strawberries are rich in vitamin C, which aids collagen production and iron absorption, other factors may promote hair growth.

name: Sunflower Seeds
properties: Rich in vitamin E and other nutrients that may promote hair growth. Some seeds also contain omega-3s, which have been linked to hair growth. Biotin found in sunflower seeds is essential for the production of a hair protein called keratin.

name: Oyster
properties: Oysters are one of the best sources of zinc in the diet. This mineral helps to support the hair growth and repair cycle.
